phrase.item: Then they bring it [home] and make it pure using a stainer.
After straining, they bring and boil it.
After it boils they pour it in a pot.
In top they add to it a little bit of buttermilk.
When they add buttermilk to it, it becomes a curdle kefir.
Then the butter gets separate [from curdle].
When the butter is ready, from there they pour the buttermilk in a cauldron.
Then they make fire under it [the cauldron].
When it boils a lot, it turns into qərɨt [sour kefir].
When it gets thick they take out put it on the roof [to get dry].
They make round and put it there to get dry.
Once it's dry they put it in a dish and take it to the village.
A dried sour kefir can be used for soup or 'qrətovər' [traditional meal made of dried sour kefir].
